term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - radiant exitance, M
term.title: radiant exitance

item.text: Radiant power, P, emitted at all wavelengths by an element of surface containing the source point under consideration divided by the area of the source. SI unit is W m-2.

notes.item: Mathematical definition: M = dP/dS. If the radiant power P is constant over the surface area considered, M = P/S.

Equivalent to the integration of the radiant power leaving a source over the solid angle and over the whole wavelength range. Mathematical definition: M = ∫(λ).Mλ.⁢dλ, where M λ is the spectral radiant exitance at wavelength λ.
Same as spherical radiant exitance. Formerly called radiant emittance.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 409 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
